manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Supplementing with Vitamin C: Vitamin C, also known as Ascorbic Acid, is an essential nutrient naturally found in citrus fruits like oranges, grapefruit, and strawberries. It's also featured in various supplement forms such as, capsules, liquid, gummies, and pills. Deliciously Powerful Chewables: At Carlyle, our Vitamin C Chewable for adults is the easy and delicious way to power up with this essential nutrient. Orange flavored chewable tablets deliver 1000mg of Vitamin C per serving, plus Rose Hips for naturally occurring antioxidants. Get premium support you can trust at the best value with our 180-tablet bottle. Carlyle Vitamin C Chewable - Rooted in Wellness: Our expertise in sourcing the purest ingredients combined with advanced technologies makes us proud to deliver premium, honest supplements at the best value. Carlyle Vitamin C Chewable is a testament to our commitment to excellence, made with powerful ingredients rooted in wellness. Thanks for choosing us in your pursuit of living healthy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value & Effective
reviews.reviewText: I’m not qualified to judge the efficacy based on Scientific facts. My experience was that I took 3,000 mg of these everyday and I didn’t get a cold virus when everyone else around me did. My husband who never gets sick (literally one cold in 14 years) got a cold/virus and I never got it. I started getting him to take it, and his cold is out improving. My very picky daughter doesn’t like the flavor, so I cut them in quarters (they are large tablets) so she can swallow them.Also, the price is the best I have found for a quality Vitamin C chewable.My only critique is that they are a little bitter and acidic, but I think that’s probably because they aren’t loaded with added sugar-so it’s probably a good thing. I just make sure to have a glass of water handy when I take them.I would recommend these to everyone that doesn’t like getting sick.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Is good tasting

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars chewable and good tasting
reviews.reviewText: I was taking a large horse pill. I had to chew this to swallow it. It tasted nasty. These vitamin c's are to big to swallow without chewing, but taste delicious. I also take a vitamin D pill with these daily. I haven't had a cold in two years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Chewable Vitamin C, But Is It Really A Value?
reviews.reviewText: While this vitamin C is a good product in my opinion, the price has increased drastically. The vitamin C tablets are in chewable form. It's slightly sweet and slightly tart, but I've really enjoyed the flavor and for the value at the time of my purchases, thought this was one of the best deals on Amazon. I paid $9.99 for the same size as currently listed, 180 chewable tablets. Now, it is selling for $12.99, a $3 increase, with a list price of $15.28. Supposedly saving you $2.29...that is not true. When I purchased this item, twice over several months, the cost was not a sale price but original price at $9.99. So don't let them make you believe you're getting such a great deal at 15% savings. I'm fed up with Amazon trying to make you feel as though you're getting a deal when there are thousands of verified purchasers who know the original prices of the items they received. Other than that folks, if you like chewable vitamin C tablets, it is worth a try.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is chewable and they are great for the price, will order again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 1,000 mg PER SERVING - 2 CHEWABLE TABLETS IS A SERVING - What's so hard to understand?
reviews.reviewText: I don't get those people who complain that they were duped into buying this because it takes two tablets to equal 1,000 mg of Vitamin C. It's clear in the listing - clear on the pictures of the label - there's no deceit here. It is quite common for Vitamin C chewable tablets to be 500 mg - so with many brands you have to take two to get a 1,000 mg dose. I buy these mostly because I like the flavor. Sometimes chewable Vitamin C is just too tart for my likes. I also like that I can take my 1,000 mg dose (2 tablets) then supplement during the day with 500 mg (1 tablet) doses when I feel I need an extra boost of Vitamin C.

reviews.reviewText: Dissolves easily; gives daily vitamin C requirements.
